item.title: Putting in your form?
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

To detect if a button is clicked, then you’ll need to add something, like this, at the end of your button setting up area: Button1.OnClick := @ProcedureHere;

Replace ProcedureHere with your procedure. However, your procedure must contain the following parametres: (Sender: TObject);

So, it might look something like:[code]
procedure ClickingProcedure(Sender: TObject); //Focus here.
begin
Writeln(‘Button has been clicked/pressed.’);
end;

procedure Form1;
begin
Button1.OnClick:=@ClickingProcedure; //And Focus here.
end;[/code]

Well, there you go, if you need more support, please post here

item.title: Putting in your form?
item.dc:creator: @solemn_wishes solemn wishes
item.description:
@solemn_wishes wrote:

Do you mean changing the captions of the buttons and stuff you make with the form editor? i do not quite understand.

Label1 := TLabel.Create(RCtest);
Label1.Parent := RCtest;
Label1.Left := 8;
Label1.Top := 16;
Label1.Width := 51;
Label1.Height := 13;
Label1.Caption := 'ThisISTest';

If you wanted to change the caption in this code you would simple go to where is says ‘Label1.Caption := ‘ThisISTest’;’ and change the text there. Pretty straightfoward.
